intro: Hieracium macilentum subsp. sparsipilum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in the summer months. The subspecies sparsipilum is distinguished by its sparse hair coverage and slender stems.
